title: ALPR audit (Kansas City Kansas Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

title: Records related to Unidentified Remains in NYC from 1999-2005

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Records related to Unidentified Remains in NYC from 1999-2005
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of unidentified female remains in New York City, particularly Brooklyn, from March 1999–2005, matching the description of Leanne Marie Hausberg (DOB: ~1985, NamUs #MP5599, NCMEC #861608, Navajo/White, 5’4”, 120 lbs, brown hair/eyes, small scar on right cheek), including any DNA, dental, or physical comparisons to her profile.
2. OCME’s protocols or reports on identifying Indigenous missing persons (1999–present), particularly regarding misclassification (e.g., Navajo/White listed as White or Hispanic).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Aziz

title: Bodycam - El Cajon

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Bodycam - El Cajon
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the February 25, 2025, incident involving Richard Leyva in El Cajon, CA, where police discovered the body of Jamison Webster in the trunk of a vehicle following a pursuit and collision. Please provide all available body-worn camera footage, dashcam footage, 911 calls, radio traffic, surveillance video, arrest reports, incident reports, use-of-force documentation, and any other records or media generated in connection with this case. This request includes any related metadata and officer narratives.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tavin Way

communications.subject: El Cajon Public Records Request for Police Department No. PRR25-494, Topic: General
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the El Cajon Police Department. We have received your request for information and will begin processing it. A response to this request will be sent in a timely manner as allowed by California Government Code Section 7922.535.  In unusual circumstances, that time period may be extended an additional 14 days. We make every effort to respond to requests for information as quickly as possible. Normal business hours (lobby open to public) are: 
Monday-Thursday, 8:00am-5:00pm, and every other Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm. To check on the status of your request, return to the Public Records site and click on Lookup Request. *NOTE: At "Lookup Request", enter the tracking number, and click on the Submit button (Enter key will not work). You will be prompted for this tracking number, PRR25-494, along with your email, 189270-75817897@requests.muckrock.com

title: Bodycam Footage - LVMPD

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Bodycam Footage - LVMPD
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to the arrest of Eric Holland on December 23, 2021, who was found in possession of a severed human head. Specifically, I request the full, unedited body-worn camera footage from all officers involved before, during, and after the stop; dash camera footage from any patrol vehicles present; any surveillance or third-party video collected during the investigation; audio recordings including radio dispatch and 911 calls; and all related reports such as incident reports, use-of-force reports (if applicable), arrest reports, and officer statements. Additionally, I request any metadata associated with the video and audio files, including timestamps, officer identifiers, and GPS data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tavin Way

title: Use of the Term "Housing Ready" – Mayor’s Office and Housing Dept Records

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Use of the Term "Housing Ready" – Mayor’s Office and Housing Dept Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All records created or received between January 1, 2023 and the date of production that contain the phrase “housing ready,” including but not limited to:

1. Emails, memoranda, presentations, talking points, internal reports, training or outreach documents, sent or received by staff in the Mayor’s Office or the Mayor’s Office of Housing, including but not limited to Sheila Dillon, Mayor Michelle Wu, and their direct reports.

2. Any such records contained in text messages, iMessages, or messaging apps (such as WhatsApp, Signal, Slack, Microsoft Teams) on City-issued or personal devices used for official business.

3. Any drafts, internal versions, or unpublished materials containing the phrase, regardless of whether they were finalized or shared externally.

4. Please provide any document that defines "housing ready" 

The term “housing ready” has been used publicly by City official

https://www.boston.gov/news/mayor-michelle-wu-leads-43rd-annual-homeless-census

- If no responsive records exist for a given category, please confirm that in writing.
- Identify the custodians and systems searched, and summarize the search methods used.
- Provide responsive materials in machine-readable format (CSV, Excel, EML, DOCX, unlocked PDFs, etc.), including metadata (dates, sender/recipient, subject lines).
- Include any drafts, revisions, or unpublished versions.
- Provide any policies, notices, or instructions to staff relating to how relevant records are handled, retained, or deleted.

I prefer to receive records electronically and on a rolling basis. If fees apply, please notify me in advance.

If no responsive records are found, please provide confirmation pursuant to 950 CMR 32.06(3)(c).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: City Public Records Request :: R003432-070725
communications.communication:
Dear Brian McCarter, Thank you for your interest in public records of City of Boston. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 7/7/2025 10:43:56 PM and given the reference number R003432-070725 for tracking purposes. To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All records created or received between January 1, 2023 and the date of production that contain the phrase “housing ready,” including but not limited to:

1. Emails, memoranda, presentations, talking points, internal reports, training or outreach documents, sent or received by staff in the Mayor’s Office or the Mayor’s Office of Housing, including but not limited to Sheila Dillon, Mayor Michelle Wu, and their direct reports.

2. Any such records contained in text messages, iMessages, or messaging apps (such as WhatsApp, Signal, Slack, Microsoft Teams) on City-issued or personal devices used for official business.

3. Any drafts, internal versions, or unpublished materials containing the phrase, regardless of whether they were finalized or shared externally.

4. Please provide any document that defines "housing ready"

The term “housing ready” has been used publicly by City official

https://www.boston.gov/news/mayor-michelle-wu-leads-43rd-annual-homeless-census

- If no responsive records exist for a given category, please confirm that in writing.
- Identify the custodians and systems searched, and summarize the search methods used.
- Provide responsive materials in machine-readable format (CSV, Excel, EML, DOCX, unlocked PDFs, etc.), including metadata (dates, sender/recipient, subject lines).
- Include any drafts, revisions, or unpublished versions.
- Provide any policies, notices, or instructions to staff relating to how relevant records are handled, retained, or deleted.

I prefer to receive records electronically and on a rolling basis. If fees apply, please notify me in advance.

If no responsive records are found, please provide confirmation pursuant to 950 CMR 32.06(3)(c).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-of-boston-public-records-access-officer-17150%252Fuse-of-the-term-housing-ready-mayors-office-and-housing-dept-records-189250%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicrecords%252540boston.gov&url_auth_token=AABSC6gUxVO4pA5M4Eve1igjMVo%3A1uYyIC%3AHNOBOliVbuOSCTC_TvXAc3Rrw6fXfMgf8fe5MyA3Bt8 You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. Director of Public Records 
Records Access Officer 
City of Boston

title: James Lloydovich Patterson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: James Lloydovich Patterson
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to James Lloydovich Patterson. He was born on 17 July 1933 in Moscow, Russia, USSR and died on 22 May 2025.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

James Lloydovich Patterson was the son of an African American father and a Russian mother who promoted Soviet ideals of racial harmony.

PROOF OF DEATH

Attached is Mr. Patterson’s obituary from the Washington Post.

SCOPE OF SEARCH
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction. If previously-released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

title: Request on Political Appointees (U.S. Department of Education)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of any and all political appointments at the agency appointed from January 20, 2025 until the date of your final response to this request.

2. Copies of resumes for any and all political appointees hired since January 20, 2025 until the date of your final response to this request. These records are likely in the possession of the Designated Agency Ethics Official (DAEO).

Please provide these records as available on a rolling basis.

Documented is an investigative watchdog and reporting group that explores the relationship between special interests and government. This request is likely to contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations of the government. Disclosure of the requested records serves the public interest, and this request is not being made for any commercial purposes. Therefore, I am requesting a waiver of any fees. If you do not grant my fee waiver request, please notify me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by email attachment or other electronic file transfer if available, or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.  I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Nina
